Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: F K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3nights and was recommended by a travel agency. As you walk into the hotel it does look 4star, nice decor, however the big paintings are awfull , looks like a raw canvas! The reception staff , came across as being a bit zombie -fied, no expression of joy whatsoever !! Our room was claustrophobic, no tea or coffee making facilities or fridge, even thou we were told that there would be , by the travel agency. When I rang reception I was told that these facilities do not come in a standard room, if it's a 4 star, you think it would be standard throughout! Air conditioning was not working, as according to reception its not hot enough yet, we only had the joy of warm air or hot!! Hence the windows were opened at night and suffered the traffic noise. Breakfast very basic , hot food was Luke warm and on my last day the beans were so cold , seemed like they just took them out of the can. However the plus points are that the shower was amazing , sadly on one day the hotel had no water, and it was dribbling from the tap, we showered in the evening! The toiletries were not bad. Location - for the beach is excellent , if you want to stay away from the hustle bustle it's good as the hotel is not far from the Metro, 10 min walk. The pizza restaurant next door Is good and staff friendly - Hotel reception staff should pop in and take notes!! I wouldn't return to this hotel and as we got into our taxi to go to the Airport I did have the impulse to run out with a thick black marker and scribble 2 stars out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: My gf and I spent 4 days/nights here in April '12. The location was out of the way, but across the street from the beach and just a few blocks from the train (which was very convenient and we used it daily). Upon check-in the staff seemed bothered by our presence, as they did at every other interaction. The room itself can be described as an IKEA room display after a weekend of people testing everything out- nice at first glance, but falling apart. The bed creaked loudly at every movement. The closet was so shallow that hangers only fit in sideways. I tried to use the A/C only to learn that they don't turn it on for the building until May. The window was difficult to use- until it stopped working completely. Perhaps most incredible was the bathrrom. The shower (no tub) had glass where only one shower door would normally go. Consequently water splashed all over the bathroom floor and out into the hallway. How a hotel could have such terrible functionality is amazing to me.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars too many”
Reviews.Author: NV-NYC
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel we were greeted by unwelcoming employees. They looked at us like we were bothering them. We were far from the center city but across the street from the beach. We had a bad experience from the bed springs hurting our backs to the bathroom smelling llike sewer water. The closet didn't even fit a regular size coat hanger. The bathroom shower was half enclosed but the base wasnt steep enough and the water went out to the hall. The spa was one room with a bed for a "massage" or more like claustophobic closet. The hotel advises free wifi but not in your room, you have to sit downstairs in the lobby to use it. I've traveled to even third world countries where their two star hotels were better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location but bad service and poor room.”
Reviews.Author: Paulbo4
Reviews.Content: We checked into a room on the 6th floor and it was tiny and so so hot! it had no air con for cool air! only blows what the weather is like outside so hot is hot!! we complained and a technician said it was fine. The hotel receptionist wasn't very helpful (Christian) so we had a tossing and turning night and had to have the window open to try and cool it down but traffic was loud. We contacted the booking agent and in fairness we had our room changed but not because of the hotel it took 2 complaints! Bare in mind I've stayed at hundreds of hotels this was my first complaint! nice across from the beach, 5 minute walk to Diagonal Mar shopping centre. 10 min walk to Selva de Mar metro and 10 mins ride into city (pretty cheap £10 for 10 trips) Breakfast was average, did have free internet which was good. overall I really wouldn't recommend, if you do stay don't get 6th or 7th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, awkward location”
Reviews.Author: mukdahan
Reviews.Content: Easy to find hotel from the metro station. Right on the beach front. this is a smart business class hotel, the room was well equipped (no tea and coffee) and in good order. Only had two single beds pushed together which was a shame. Were offered another room in the hotels second building but this was much smaller so we stayed put. Very helpful reception staff. Didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on food but seemed well priced. The location is in the business district, so local eating and nightlife is nearly nonexistent. There is a supermarket round the corner and a couple of cafes but that's it. However the metro is close and very easy to get around on. 18 euros for 3 days unlimited travel including train from airport. Would return in the summer as it right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: louiepWales
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the Front Maritim and found it to be a good base for our weekend break in Barcelona. Our sea view room was comfortable and clean and we found the staff helpful and polite. We would have paid much more for a similar quality hotel in the city centre. The only slight issue would be that the sea view rooms are noisy because the road outside is very busy so if you like a quiet room, don't take the sea view option. Although it is a long way from central Barcelona, the tube station is only a 5 minute walk and we found the Barcelona metro very efficient and using the transport pass, a bargain too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Milenearc
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers you great accomodation with a very good breakfast. The hotel is situated in the first line of the sea wich is great, however it becomes far from the city centre (20-30 min by metro).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with unique surrounding”
Reviews.Author: gregntrees
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel give you a new different experiences. Its not close to the city but hotel's unique surrounding provide you the senses of having a good holiday in Barcelona. Helpfull and friendly staff, great breakfast another good additional facilities to the hotel. If you wake up a bit early you can see nice sunrise just outside the hotel

Reviews.Title: “A little bit away from bars and nightlife, but near the beach, metro close by”
Reviews.Author: imb23
Reviews.Content: Polite staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds. lovely pizza next door, wonderful scent of woodsmoke from the stove!

Reviews.Title: “Nice seaview rooms”
Reviews.Author: Emy2k
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week in a seaview room and had a nice time. The staff were helpful and polite and they provided a big map on arrival. The hotel is a 10min walk from the subway which gets you to the city in another ten minutes. The beach is just across the road, has a great running, skating and cycling track. You can walk into Barceloneta in about 40 minutes all along the beach. If you don't want to go into town for dinner, don't bother with the hotel restaurant: it's awful. Try the pizzeria next door instead.

Reviews.Title: “Four night stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave H
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for the conference and rthe no.41 bus will take you into the city. (Buy a Barcelona Card to get free travel and discounts during your stay). The hotel is modern, clean and right near the beach. Staff were all very helpful and spoke English well enough, given our limited Spanish. There is limited Wifi access, which, for a city like Barcelona, famous for its wifi points, is a little disappointing. Our room was reasonable, though it did smell of smoke. The bathroom was generous, shower worked, but not the tap over the bath. The Aircon was not very effective - even in November, we needed it. One evening, the water stopped working completely, but it did come back on half an hour later. We ate in the restaurant one evening. It was 'euro-fare', but reasonable priced at 14 euros each. Breakfasts are typical, buffet type where you can eat as much as you like from a wide selection.

Reviews.Title: “Bit expansive”
Reviews.Author: Arunkarur
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for couple of nights. For me i felt this hotel was bit expansive and not worth the money, may be because i booked last moment. But the location is very good close the beach and the staffs where friendly but they need to improve the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeannette R
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 nights in the hotel, having 2 rooms (1 double bed, 1 with 2 single beds). Personal was very uninterested. Beds were bad, spings sticking through in your back.On day 4 we couldnt get in our rooms, they had checked us out. No excuses made, they only checked us in again for the last night. No minibar, no opportunity to make coffee or tea. Rooms are very small and very noicy. Breakfast was good. Location is fine. Beach at the other side of the road, metro and bus on walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, in a nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Erica d
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the hotel, where we spend 4 nights. It was nice to stay near the beach and near the shopping mall. if you like sushi you have to go there for lunch, all you can eat for 10 euro. it was very good!! There were also some very nice restaurants on Paseo Garcia, and they open till late. Food is good, service is friendly. Best thing to travel to the center, take the metro and buy a ticket with 10 strips. you can use it for more then one person.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Joey1114
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the hotel. The location is absolutely beautiful. The city centre was very easy to access from the hotel by using the bus 41 from behind the hotel. The beach is beautiful and access is easy. The only problem we had was the constant rushing of water we heard in our room all night. it was as though the whole drain pipes passed through our room. we asked to be moved, but we were told all the rooms have the same problem. Bedsides the drain problem, we had a very lovely time and looking forward to going back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: RuningMan1
Reviews.Content: I stayed four days at Front Maritim in September, 2011. The hotel is across the street from the beach on the eastern edge of Barcelona. About four blocks away is a metro station, so access to the center is easy. The beaches are beautiful and access was easy. My room had a limited view of the sea. The hotel itself was only average. It was warm during my stay and the air conditioning wasn't working. I asked the front desk to have someone check, but I think the air wasn't working for any of the rooms, as the temperature in the hallway was stifling, also. Opening my window gave only limited relief, as air flow into my room was limited. The rest of the hotel was typical European minimalist. The room was fairly small - I wouldn't recommend them for more than 1 or 2 people. There was no bathtub, only a glass enclosed shower. The bed was a small queen with a thin mattress. No pillowtop or pillow menu as in the U.S. Also, no coffee or iron. Breakfast buffet had a limited selection and at 9 euros was expensive. I think there are better options in the area than Front Maritim, but it would do in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “when you feel that they JUST want money...”
Reviews.Author: lolo_lolo72
Reviews.Content: I cannot say that I had a great experience with this hotel. Here the situation, up to you to judge. 3 majour problem ( booking, cortesy, hotel location). BOOKING - CHECK IN I booked 3 rooms (two double and one single room) for 5 days via their web site. I have choosed the email booking without PRE-Payment two months in advance with a good hotel room rate. Once arrived in the hotel (with my other collegues) we were shocked by the fact that they insist us to pay straing the full amount for the 5 days in advance. (I am a business traveller, it never happen to me that an hotel ask me to pay in advance). I was not happy, We asked to see the rooms before the payment of the full amount. Incredible enought they gave us a card key without anyone coming with us. (very unplasent). I am still disappointed, they had my credit card in deposit! what is happening if the hotel services were awful - were they ready to refund me?? LOCATION The hotel is in a moder area but far away from everything. Good for the beach but far away from tube stations or shopping areas. CURTESY Apart for the room visit by ourself, let me add another point. Due to flight strike, we were forced to stay one day longer in Barcellona. The hotel did not help at all and more that ever they increased the additional night of 40%. I did not appreciated. In addition, every time we went to the desk asking for help WE had clear feeling that we were not appreciated as customers. One day a member of our team left his Tshirt on top of the bed and unfortunatly the cleaning lady during the sheet changes took the Tshirt and dirty sheets with her. We ask several time to check where the Tshirt was. After insisting, at the reception desk a person went in back door and come back with the shirt in his hands. Not very professional. We did not expect to clean the Tshirt but at least to give us back in a bag or a Tshirt folder. Defenitly bad manner for a 4 stars hotel. In term of hotel, rooms are nice and clean. A little bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but far from the city attractions”
Reviews.Author: KLFZ
Reviews.Content: Nice 4 * hotel, just 3 min walk to the beach, but away from the city attractions and require 10 min walk to reach bus or metro station, it suits people for beach relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel just across the beach”
Reviews.Author: JulKiev
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before cruise in August. Nice hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. Located just across the beach and not far from the city center (around 10 euro by taxi to La Rambla, metro station in 5 minutes walking distance with direct line to Placa de Catalunya) it is excellent place to stay in Barcelona. Room was nice and clean with a side sea view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Msbetsie
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday from a beautiful holiday in Europe. We went on the Disney Cruise Lines, which I would HIGHLY recommend to anyone looking for a great cruise. The day before the cruise we stayed overnight in Barcelona and stayed at the GBB Hotel Front Maritim. The price was $167.00 (inclusive of tax) in Canadian dollars. This also included a really good continental breakfast. The hotel is located near the water and there are great restaurants around the area (short walk). Make sure you try the "paella" it is really good! Do the "Hop On, Hop Off" to see the City but don't buy the package from the Hotels (that was a waste of 50 Euros) just buy the day pass on the bus itself for 23 Euros each adult.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel near the beach”
Reviews.Author: heavyrail
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we'd like to stay near the beach in Barcelona and pay reasonable price. We do not remember if all the rooms have sea view, but we've got one with the windows facing the seaside, and this was beautiful. The beach was just across the busy road, and it was very romantic to get up early in the morning, go to the beach and see the sun rising from the sea. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked well (that is important in the hot summer time).

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel but adequate”
Reviews.Author: gittinsclan
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights, booked through a travel agent at the end of a cruise and formed part of our package so was not chosen by us. We have stayed at many hotels and would not class this as a 4 star hotel. The rooms are basic. The telephone in our son's room did not work, there was loose wiring and although we asked for it to be repaired it wasn't. The black out curtain in our room had a 3 foot rip in it and dangled down. It was very shabby as were the sheets on one of the beds. The glass bathroom basin had huge sharp chip in it and there were no basic tea/coffee making facilities that I would expect from a 4 star hotel. The only English TV channels were news channels. The breakfast was ok, lots of continental choices. The staff were pleasant and helpful. We found the location ok and travelled to and from Barcelona on the tourist bus. We ate at the port restaurants all nights and enjoyed the pleasant walk...avoid one of the buffet restaurants like the plague " Rebujito". They charge 13 euros pp before you eat. All of the food had been there for hours and was either cold/hard. The pizza was like cardboard and when we complained we got nowhere...and they already had our money. Barna Biers a couple of restaurants down was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel outside the city centre”
Reviews.Author: KuHz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of August. The hotel is nice and staff is helpful (even though some of them at the reception did not have knowledge to give some answers for some "easy" question of Barcelona city). Hotel is near to beach and the neighborhood is peaceful. Hotel is a bit far from the city centre, but if you are ready to travel with subways or taxis, it's ok. Taxi ride from hotel to city centre is about 10 euros and sub is cheap. Room was clean and very basic. Classic style, nothing foo fancy but it offered everything we needed for our short visit. Wardrobe was pretty small and there is only one basic mirror in the room (wc). Free Internet in a room is nice. In our room the slot for RJ45-cable was broken but somehow I got it fixed. Bathroom was ok with soaps and shampoos and the towels were changed daily. Breakfast was ok. Maybe not worth of 9 euros but was an easy choice. If you are willing to spend some time at beach, this hotel might be your choice. There is only a couple of hundred of meters to walk to peaceful beach and if you are travelling light you are able to loan a towel from the reception free of charge. Tip: You are able to buy tickets to official Barcelona City Tour from reception and the buses will pass near by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Petra F
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel which is really close to the beach and sea. We had a quite small room, but anyway, we travelled and spent time just outside on the beach and in the town, so I think that it was enought for us. We didn´t have a breakfast, and I have to say that it was a good choice for us! We used to have a dinner there in the hotel, three course menu and really good for the good price. Near to the hotel is a Diagonal mar - shopping center. We really enjoyed our stay and we have been satisfied with the hotel and hotel staff! Thank you Front Maritim!!!

Reviews.Title: “a clean, modern hotel a few kilometers from the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: MGATL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. It's a decent hotel, but not above average. The lobby is attractive, modern and clean. Same for the dining area. The hotel faces the sea, though between the hotel and the water is a wide street with divider, walkway, parking and beach. The rooms were small but typical of a European room size. The beds were ok, but the pillows were thin and uncomfortable. The breakfast buffet was considerably better than average, with a wide and generous selection of good foods in all categories, and two coffee machines that made espresso, cafe con leche and other very good coffee drinks at the push of a button. Dinner, on the other hand, was horrible! The location is convenient to the beach and a few kilometers from the key tourist attractions. The fitness center was an extra fee and was in a small locked room--hardly enticing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent `Value”
Reviews.Author: JaneDonavon
Reviews.Content: I have payed £65 a night for a room with breakfast. The hotel is very clean, modern and quiet. Great breakfast ,but avoid the scrambled egg - mainland Europe just cant do it. The TV has several English channels and I have free wifi in my first floor room right now. The beach is about 200m away. We ate in the hotel restaurant last night - 15 euros for 3 courses and a glass of wine, so pretty good value. Tonight we ate in the pizzeria next door: go for the pizza - its the real thing, but don't arrive at the stated opening time of 7.30 as they dont really get going until about 8. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Proximately what you expect”
Reviews.Author: travellerwithmusic
Reviews.Content: Pretty good value for the money. A bit of a seaview if you're lucky, close to the beach, modern, clean area. Staff not specifically friendly, for a big hotel it's understandable. Room nice, a fridge would have been nice. Otherwise happy with the stay. Would reccomend it. Parking was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Ted_from_Oliva
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern and functional, sometimes verging on clinical. Rooms are large and bright, but no drawers and very limited storage space. Facilities surprisingly poor for a four star hotel, eg: no swimming pool, no fridge/minibar in rooms, WiFi in public areas only. Air-conditioning only appeared to work within a restricted range. Food reasonable but unexceptional. Hotel bar (and others in immediate area) expensive, but several good bars, including Bar Restaurant Angel, in the street behind. The hotel is fairly remote from the city centre (€10 taxi ride), but there is an underground station within about 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Pilier3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel on a recent visit to Barcelona. Being slightly off-centre to Barcelona city centre it was a good location. Whilst in what could be described as a concrete jungle setting it was still nice and peaceful with lots of open areas withmature trees & palms, good seating and grass areas, all very clean and strangely relaxing and welcoming. It also has some nice local restaurants dotted around; banks and ATMs were available too. The hotel was a stone's throw from the beach, which was handy to relax at after a hard day's touring around the city. The Metro line Selva de Mar is excellent for Barceloneta and Jaume 1 on L4. The L4 Metro is short walk from the hotel with the opportunity to take a 'coffee amb lei' or granizados on the way to or from the Metro station. If you get the chance then go into town on the tramlink. The Selva de Mar tram stop is situated just up from the Metro stations Selva de Mar. It's a nice trip into town on the surface. The tram treminates just above the Vila Olimpica marina so it's a decent walk into Las Ramblas or a short walk to the marina and then along along the coastline. On the hotel itself there is little to say, it's a four star, it's average, the bar isn't always staffed, the rooms are on the small side. Our shower rail in our shower had been installed upside down and needed to to be re-fixed the top end being very loose. As the rail was on uspside down, the shower head didn't fit into the holder. Not a major issue but annoying. It is meant to be fancy but as usual the lack of attention to maintenance and to the detail lets it down. The hotel offers beach towels if you want to go to the beach but demand a 10€ deposit - cash! It can't be put onto the room (they have your credit card details from check-in!). It's not clear that a cash deposit is required and it's not so handy being told if you're not carrying cash to the beach. The staff are professional if a little perfunctory. More than happy to tell you what they can't do for you rather than what they can...

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and convenient for beach and metro”
Reviews.Author: homelessinwales
Reviews.Content: We liked the fact that they give you a beach towell (10 euro returnable deposit). We went for 3 nights so only took hand luggage. No room for a towell so this was a bonus. Breakfast was 9 euros but worth every penny especially as most people made extra rolls for their lunch--quite openly too. It's a long walk to Las Ramblas but the metro is only 10 minutes away so it doesn't matter if you don't like walking. We did a 3 day metro ticket for 16.5 euros---good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast buffet, modern decor, far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: shaaley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 3 nights before setting off on a cruise. Overall, our experience was decent. The staff was always very professional and helpful. The breakfast buffet was the best one we encountered (except for the scrambled eggs, but I discovered NO one can get the eggs right in Spain/Italy for some reason). But the cost was too much. We could have eaten at a cafe around the corner for a lot cheaper. The room itself was very very small. The bed took up most of the room. But it was clean and tidy, decorated in modern, minimalist decor. The bathroom was quite nice. Nice green marble. Big shower, yet with no door or curtain, so the floor tended to get wet outside the shower. The bathroom amenities were great. You got shampoo, conditioner, soap, as well as a razor and a travel toothbrush and paste, and a little vanity pack. And lots of fluffy white towels. We couldn't find a safe. Don't recall a mini bar either, but I never use them so I don't really look. There was free wifi with a strong connection in the lobby. Oh and they didn't tell us how to turn on the lights in our room! You need to put your door card in a slot before the lights work. When my boyfriend went down to inquire about it, he heard a staff member telling another guest how to do it. Perhaps they should have mentioned that to foreign tourists? Or have a sign or something in the room? The location is both good and bad, I suppose. Good in that it's in a quiet - almost dead - neighbourhood. And I felt safe there. Bad in that it is many long blocks to walk to the metro to get to the city centre area. Also, being in a non-touristy area, language barrier certainly was an issue. Though the hotel staff all seemed to speak decent English, which was nice. It would have been nice to have an english TV channel or two. CNN, BBC, something? Just be warned, we took a short cab ride to the cruise ship port and the guy manually tacked on a 6.50 euro charge at the very end (we only had 2 bags). When we asked him about it, he responded in Spanish. How can we argue with that?? I don't know if we would return to this hotel. We might like to try another place, maybe closer to the centre of town, or even a metro station. For those of you into the "night life", this area is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great shower, great location for Primavera but the rest is lacking.”
Reviews.Author: GreyRiverBear
Reviews.Content: We've been here for 3 days now and while Barcelona has been amazing, our hotel has been a bit of a downpoint. The air con has been broken since we arrived and we have a running joke about it. Basically every time we mention (5 times now) it to reception, they note our room number but no details about the problem - they clearly know they can't fix it from their lame excuses but why can't they just say so? In addition though, the staff are pleasant but just not the best. It's 4 star prices for 2 star service. Just tried calling room service 3 times but no answer. I think that says everything...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: pccbcn2011
Reviews.Content: I think it is a very nice place to stay. Close to the sea, very nice hotel personal working there, trying to be helpful every time. To me everything was great. I would only suggest to put a small refrigerator in every room and put some english channels on TV.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: CaliTeacher2004
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for five nights in mid April. We couldn't be more pleased with the experience. The hotel staff was friendly and professional throughout our stay and the front desk always had at least one person on duty who spoke English well. The room was cleaner and slightly larger than we anticipated considering the price and was certainly reflective of a 4 star hotel. On day two of our stay we did receive a call from the desk notifying us that our shower produced a leak near the restaurant. They helped us move into another room and they gave us free breakfast for the remainder or our stay. They even gave my mom free breakfast and she wasn't even in the same room as ours. When we left to the airport early in the morning they were kind enough to pack our breakfast for us without us even having to ask. I couldn't be more pleased with our stay. The metro was a short 6-10min walk, and both sightseeing buses had stops by our hotel. The beach was beautiful, the surrounding neighborhood felt calm and safe, and there was a huge mall three blocks away that had a great supermarket within it. Oh, and free wi-fi in the lobby and broadband in the rooms! Great hotel! If we visit Barcelona again we'll certainly stay here once more.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay.”
Reviews.Author: alsch1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in february to celebrate my birthday. We were given a room with ocean view which were great. The size of the room was perfect for two people and the bed was just to my liking. The staff were wery helpful and friendly, specially since we had some issues with the keycards, so we got locked out of the room a couple of times. The breakfast was really tasteful with a great selection, and I have stayed a four star hotels that didn't have this kind of offering. We tried the restaurant one evening and really enjoyed the food. The hotels location is somewhat far from the city center, but it's only a short walk to the metro or tram, that'll get you to the center in 10-15 min. The area isn't the most exiting, but it does allow you to sleep, I have stayed at a hotel just of La Rambla and it was very noisy all night. Dining in the area is limited, however there is a very nice restaurant next to Selva de Mar metro station. Overall I would recommend this hotel with out any second thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: juakoppi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this modern beachfront hotel in May. Room was nice but a little cold because of aircon. Breakfast was wonderful, the best we have had! Location is quite far from center but beach is very close and there is good bus connection to the city center. We were also very pleased of the fact that the hotel had so good facilities, sauna, gym, free internet connection, free mineral and spring water.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: BigIan22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a stop over for 2 nights while waiting to go on a cruise from Barcelona port and found the hotel very nice and the staff friendly. The hotel itself was very clean and the rooms where excellent for our requirements. The breakfast buffet was great and well organised and we where allowed to leave our bags free of charge in the hotel lock up while we explored Barcelona before leaving for our cruise. A taxi to the main La Rambla area is around 8euro but was worth the cost to stay in such a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned”
Reviews.Author: swimmingfools
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel wiht my husband for a few nights in October 2010 Room tiny, no safe , no tea/coffee, no iron/ironing board available in the entire hotel!!! Very very rude staff, very unhelpful to the point of being rude. Enitre hotel needs a complete make over, cutains never cleaned in 10 years I would say. Front of house staff need some customer care skills course or else get another job!!! Very poor value for money. There are plenty of other hotels along the beach front so keep looking

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: RFWOOD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weekends on either end of a week long Mediterranean cruise. The beach across from the hotel looked great (but didn't have opportunity to swim as we werer too busy exploring Barcelona). Staff were friendly and very accomodating. The room was small by North American standards but adequate for out needs. Dinner in the restaurant was a good value, however the breakfast buffet is iverpriced unless included in the price of the room. Location is convienient to the port and near to metro and bus stations. Cab fare to the centre of the city was reasonable and cabs are plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly personal and close to metro station”
Reviews.Author: cecmix
Reviews.Content: Close to a shopping center, to the conference centre and to the beach. To visit the main tourist attractions of the city you need to take the metro. There are two metro stations close to this hotel, around 10-15 minutes on foot. It is perfect if you are looking for a more calm place than places close to La Rambla. Nevertheless if you are looking for night life or shopping, you might depend on trains or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach, shops, subway. Great place!”
Reviews.Author: 1Angie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I really enjoyed this stay in Barcelona. It is only a 5 minute walk to the beach, and 5 minutes to the local shopping centre which had plenty of places to eat and shop. It is not close to town, but you can walk to the Metro stop in 5 minutes. One evening we walked back from a resturant in town in around 20 minutes. We very happy here, as we were keen on the beach, but were able to have a day out in town without difficulty getting there. Recommended particularly for beachgoers, or people visiting for a second time who don't need to see all the sites and touristy spots- just enjoy beach and good food near comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Undersold”
Reviews.Author: Goldie1980
Reviews.Content: I checked out reviews of this hotel after having booked accommodation in Barcelona for a week-long break with my partner. I was a little apprehensive that the room might be small according to the reviews I had read and happen to believe that following my stay, the rooms were perfectly adequate for our needs. There was plenty of room for the two of us in the room and the general surroundings for the hotel were pleasant. The immediate vicinity had a few restaurants and bars and although not the bustling nightlife of the city centre, the area offered a number of choices for places to visit at night when we wanted to relax. In addition I had read reviews that rooms looking onto the dual carriageway area would be noisy. I am personally used to sleeping in silence and needed to sleep with the window open during my stay and can safely say that I was not affected by any noise from the dual carriageway. In fact, you can't really tell it is there since it is sunken below and embankment. Although the hotel is a considerable distance from the city centre, it is convenient for the night bus routes, and is only a short walk (five to ten minutes) from both the nearest metro and the tram stop. The quality of service in the hotel I felt was perfectly adequate; for my limited Spanish, all staff were friendly and went out of their way to assist me in locating some lost baggage thanks to my airline. My only criticism is that the wooden (laminate) flooring had quite obviously worn where furniture had been moved around by either guests or maids for cleaning and a much needed shower head in the men's changing room within the gym area was in need of repair. Otherwise I would recommend this hotel to anyone who isn't afraid to stretch their legs and see the wider area outside of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Snore.....”
Reviews.Author: owcprleah
Reviews.Content: The only reason I stayed here is because it was close to Parc del Forum and Primavera Sound. Unless you have business here or just want to hang out on the beach rather than see the city, you're fine. Otherwise, it's a dull, lifeless place with not much to offer in the neighborhood. Be careful not to get located on the ground floor - there's a playground with kids kicking the football around, mainly against the hotel room windows.

Reviews.Title: “Dont get excited about the sea view”
Reviews.Author: lakes99
Reviews.Content: Surprised to get a sea view we soon realised why. Your view is over a dual carriageway which is noisy all day long so book a room without a sea view which is more popular. When we stayed the air conditioning did not work and the water was switched off for 8 hours but these things are fixable. The good points are the ladies on the front desk who were very helpful and the hotel restaurant which although it does not look that special does turn out very good food particularly the fish dishes. For me the location is too far out of town for me to stay here again but if you were attending a conference in the local conference centre it would be a decent choice. Express breakfast is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsHanna
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, the bathroom was very nice. Good buffet breakfast. 5-10 minutes walk to the metro station. Overall very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough”
Reviews.Author: grose100
Reviews.Content: While I'm sure this isnt the worst hotel in Barcelona it certainly isnt worth the four stars. When I checked in I was given a non-smoking room that definitely had had people smoking in it. Then the only other room was one with single beds and im quite tall so dont fit in them properly. Other problems here include: 1. TV has no english channels 2. No wifi in room 3. Internet cable doesnt connect - looks like it hasnt been wired properly as no light on NIC 4. linen looks very worn 5. big crack in bathroom shower 6. average selection at breakfast - for 15 euro it should be better 7. No laundry service in the afternoon or on Sunday - great I need stuff clean for tomorrow and they cant do it If you're not Spanish and used to crap service then I would recommend staying elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, a long way out”
Reviews.Author: JasperJohnson
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel, I have read some of the reviews here and the problem seems to be expectation. This is not a 4 star hotel. In the UK, the equivalent would be a Premier Lodge Hotel or similar. Its OK, it isn't the Radisson Edwardian but what do you you expect for this price? My wife and I like walking so we welcomed the distance from the city centre but if you do not like walking, don't bother with this place because it is a LONG way away from all the attractions. Our main problem was with the lack of life around this part of Barcelona. The whole place is just dead and located on a dual carriageway road. On a grey spring day, the empty windswept streets and equally empty beach is actually quite depressing. It feels like Skegness in winter without the life. If you want functional space then fine but for 20 Euros more you could be in the middle of the vibrant city so near yet so far.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel with 4 star service for no star price”
Reviews.Author: frequent_flyer04
Reviews.Content: I am staying in the Front Maritim Hotel in Barcelona and I am very pleased with the hotel, the staff, the service and the room. I was a bit concerned before arriving that the price I got when I booked would mean an awful room in an awful hotel. It is close to where I need to be for work so it's location suits me; but the city centre and its touristy bits are a short bus or metro trip away. There is a beach just across the road which would be handy in the summer time - its a bit cold at the moment to do anything other than admire it from my window. I had the good fortune to encounter very helpful reception staff who let me change my room because the first one I was given was almost a bus journey away. It was on the 7th floor which they explained is why the windows are non-opening. They also keep a good supply of cables for connecting to the internet, which is free of charge in the rooms - probably so people can update trip advisor..... There are fridges of free cold mineral water at strategic points on the corridors. In warmer weather this would be useful because there is no fridge in the rooms. I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a place to stay in Barcelona, from where they can easily dip in and out of the touristy places, the nightlife and shopping but have a nice place to come back to afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for Barcelona Triathlon, triathletes (and others) be careful!”
Reviews.Author: pgee_75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Front Maritim in 2009 for the Barcelona triathlon. The hotel was ideally placed for transition and having stayed here last year for the same event I was happy to be back. However this time I had several issues with it. The first was that having all my triathlon gear set up, including my bike, I placed a "do not disturb" sign on the door handle, only to discover that the maid ignored this. In order to clean the room, she had pushed the bed into my bike. (No damage but there could have been) I then saw her take my bottle of coke from the bedside table and drink straight from it, not even using a glass. Obviously never heard of basic hygene or swine flu. I complained to hotel reception filling out a form and was promised that I would hear more about it. I am still waiting on their response. I wont be back next year at that hotel, a great shame because it was good otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: RoTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, next to the see, nice rooms, big, and bathroom very nice and big. be aware there wasn't a minibar, but they had a fridge on the hall and was refilled with free still and gas water. be aware there was 2 fridge on the hall, the one next to the lift was almost all the time empty, but the other one was having water almost all the time. we made an earlly reservation, so the money we paid was worth.

Reviews.Title: “Front Maritim ~ Less Than Anticipated”
Reviews.Author: Cliph
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Front Maritim one (1) day earlier than scheduled. They accomodated us without any fuss, at a rate lower than our four day rate! Turns out, breakfast was not included, that's why it was 20 Euros less. (The breakfast was not worth 20 Euros.) The shower had the downspout separated from the wall with a black moldy mess around it. we notified the staff so at least we did not get blamed for the damage. As advertised, the beach was close. The view was a little cluttered, but, we were there for adventure, not to stay in the room. If we ever return to Barcelona, we will not stay at the Front Maritim. There are numerous other hotels within the same price range close around. One word of warning, keep a very close watch on your valuables! Barcelona is known worldwide for the professional quality pickpockets and we only relaxed for a short time, there went my wife's wallet! We heard stories of this type of experience from numerous of our friends that were travelling at the same time as us. All in all, if you want a unique experience, I would recommend Can Besa, located in the village of Vilajuiga, 90 KM northeast of Barcelona. Very nice atmosphere, very slow pace, very relaxing and affordable. Enjoy your travels, wherever they may take you!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless night”
Reviews.Author: ViolaNysa
Reviews.Content: . This hotel is located close to the beach although it is quite far from the city centre. Our room was clean and nice with sea view but unfortunately the heating system was broken and I could not sleep as it was was boiling hot. To be fair I must admit that I didn't ask the reception desk people to move us to another room as we were tired and was too late. Apart from that I would not complain. Room service very nice with continental breakfast

Reviews.Title: “good clean comfortable hotel in quiet safe location”
Reviews.Author: flogo_9
Reviews.Content: Modern 4* hotel close to beach. Short walk to metro station to get to city centre. Staff friendly and helpful. When our air con broke down we were immediately given another room. Reception area and bedrooms very clean and comfortable. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacaChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs updating and friendlier staff. I knew that the reviews were mixed when we got there, but was convinced us to book was the fact that it was close to the beach. I would gladly have traded the beach view for a larger room. The rooms are tiny, I mean really tiny, Barely enough room for a bed, night stand and small desk. The bed takes up 90% of the room, so there is barely any space to move around. The pictures on their website is misleading, the rooms displayed must be the penthouse because our room definitely did not look like that. The towels were frayed on the edges, our sheets were torn and in general, the hotel needed upating. Albeit, the rooms were clean and the bathroom was roomy, it wasnt enough to make my stay enjoyable. I would highly recommend that viewers choose another hotel, as this one is sub-par.

Reviews.Title: “awful..and I mean it”
Reviews.Author: mmcce
Reviews.Content: We couldn't get out of this hotel fast enough. We prepaid for this so-called 4- star hotel for 3 days. We were put in two rooms (our kids in one room) and they knew that the ac didn't work because they told us that in the morning. The safe didn't work, we couldn't unlock it and we discovered at 8 am that it wouldn't be opened until 2 pm. They removed our passports and $2000. at sometime when we were out of the hotel. The fitness center was closed due to disrepair. The rooms were small , no refrigerators, the shower and sink drains didn't work...the temperature at night w/o ac was in the high 80"s. The towels were scare, skimpy and frayed. To top it off the hotel staff's interpersonal relationships with the customers was quite poor. This was not even close to a 2-star hotel. This was part of a 3 week family trip in Sicily, Malta , Rome and Spain. This was the only place that was totally unacceptable. I guess that wraps it up.

Reviews.Title: “under-staff, unfriendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: bdo_2009
Reviews.Content: 1. the hotel is very crowded and obviously under-staff 2. the room is clean but no beach view so if u want to enjoy a beachside hotel, no point to stay in this hotel 3. the staff that registered us was rude. when i asked her about the internet access, she pointed out that only the lobby is equipped w/ wi-fi, not inside the room. the room is w/ free internet access but the cable is charged at EUR5@. i said as written on the confirmation, the internet service should be free. she replied that they are not wrong as the service is free, just that the cable is charged. i was qute pissed off w/ her explanation as i feel that she is playing w/ words and being impolite. 4. when we get into the room, we find that the safe is not working. so we called the reception, after 5min somebody answered and said that they will send somebody to the room to fix it. but we have been waited for at least 15min still nobody came. so we called again, telling them we are waiting for them to come otherwise we cannot go out. then they said there is only 1 technician in the hotel so he is so busy and wont be able to fix it within short period of time. he suggest we put in the reception. so, we bring down our important stuff and kept there. of course, the safe was never been fixed before our check-out!

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: riksterinto
Reviews.Content: This has got to be one of the worst hotels I have stayed in. The service was horrible and un-friendly. If you need anything like extra pillows, make sure you ask for it before 5pm because the entire hotel basically closes at this point and only the front desk and kitchen staff is left who are pretty much useless. They claim to have a sauna and steam room however they donot turn them on unless you phone down to the front desk several times at least an hour before you want to use them. The rooms are very tiny and not kept very clean. They claim to provide free bottles of water for all guests however the fridges are usually empty and then you have to pay room service to bring you water. the free internet is very slow and sometimes does not work at all. The hotel also made a mistake with our hotel reservation and kicked us out a day early with nowhere to stay for the last day of the vacation. It doesn't make sense to me that a hotel would kick out a paying customer that is already there for a reservation that might not even show up. Especially when it waws their mistake. Seriously, find another hotel to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, in a quiet part of town”
Reviews.Author: Keylines
Reviews.Content: It was quiet which was fine and is a long walk or short ride on public transport to La Rambla. We found that as we were there for only 2 days it was a nuisance to get back to for a rest during the day. We would have had preferred closer to the main drag. Public transport is close and the Diagonal Mar Barcelona shopping centre is a 10 minute walk away. Very nice hotel. Staff fine. To get to your room you have to go down a floor and go to another lift which brings you to the floors. It would really annoy me if I had to do it for 2 weeks. Buffet breakfast choice was very good but hot water for tea luke warm. Room was clean, comfortable but a little worn in places but that doesn't bother me. Shower was huge and strong but it didn't drain well and became slippy. Did complain to front desk but nothing was done.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is too far.”
Reviews.Author: GTISingapore
Reviews.Content: Bus41 from Cataluya to hotel took almost an hour - driver cant speak english. We missed the hotel stop and seat right to the last stop! Metro is at least a 10minutes walk away. Room is new clean and nice. Definitely no sea view rooms. Only 10percent are sea view. Restaurant staff tried to over charge us on the bill.

Reviews.Title: “incorrect information”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler669
Reviews.Content: incorrect information of hotel on their internetsite. -no working wifi on rooms, in lobby fixed pc ok but very slow. -no minibar in rooms -no safety deposit box in rooms -telephone not working -no airconditiong, apparently in summer cool air and in winter warm air through outlets told by management.. -walking distance metro not 2 but 10 minutes. -rooms old, loose paintings. loose curtains etc. -free bottled water in hallway. only filled once a day and fridge empty very quickly. before 9pm.. no refills

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, salty water”
Reviews.Author: Hardgrafter
Reviews.Content: I was here on a business trip, and pleasantly surprised. Nice quiet location. The hotel is good value, and offers free wired internet and bottled water. There is a very good reason for this free water. The Barcelona water quality is terrible, and will be until the sea water desalination plant is in operation in about 2010. At the moment the water supply is salty and very hard hard. This explains the hardly working shower valves, and the complete inability to get a lather with soap - just a scum. The rooms are good, nice firm beds (to my taste anyway) and good LCD TV. The hotel restaurant is good quality and value. The access to rooms is quirky. You have to go to the basement, then walk 20m and go up in two small lifts to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: highexpextations
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not meet the standards of a four star hotel. The room was in a terrible state of disrepair, with badly worn floors, a permanently stained chair frayed at the edges, a tv stand with knife gouges, a broken shower fixture and a broken sliding door on a closet the width of a cereal box. The window was covered with accumulated dirt from the outside, and dirt and hair were evident behind the door and in the corners of the bathroom floor. There was also a half used bottle of body wash. In the hallways and in front of the elevator, the carpets were stained and obviously dirty. In addition, the ceiling in the hotel lobby is seriously water damaged. Moreover, access to the beach is over the freeway and through a large dirty parking lot. The staff at the hotel admitted that the hotel was not in good condition and said there are better three star hotels. He suggested that a four star hotel does not suggest a quality or luxury hotel, but only the size of the room as defined by the government of Spain. Staying at this hotel was a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dont' expect much”
Reviews.Author: Garla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Front Maritim Hotel from July 18-22 2008. Positives: - The hotel is right across from the beach. Very esy access to the wonderful beach, where you will find a mix of tourists and locals. - The hotel is about 8-10 minutes from Selva Del Mar metro which takes you to the city centre ie La Rambla. Very clean and safe to take even at night. - There is a Bus Turistico stop right around the corner from the hotel which is very important as you can use this to go into town if you have your ticket. One day pass 20 euro, 2 day for 26 euro. Get the 2 day pass, you will get to see much of what barca offers. - Free internet at reception. - Free bottle of water and sparkling water on each flloor, but was full around 6 pm. Good luck getting any water in the morning. - Hotel is close to Diagonal Mar shopping centre with restaurants and Zara Negatives - It costs about 26 euro from the airport to the hotel. But the A1 bus ( 4.05 euro per person) runs from Placa Catalunya to the airport. You have to take the metro the rest of the way for like 1.30 euro each. You can thank me later. Seriously. - Hotel reception staff are cool as ice. Reception? what reception? they dont receive you - they just kinda stand there. Not welcoming at all. And I am not picky at all. Not courteous. Seem to be bothered to be doing their jobs. smiles are free. - Hotel staff tried to sell us a "discount booklet" for 3 euro when we asked them about the tickets for the Bus Turistico. People, do not be fooled, these coupons are free when you buy your ticket on the bus. What a scam they tried to pull!! my wife sniffed them out. Next time, you tell them you know they are ripping u off!! - Hotel is out of the city Centre. We walked to La Rambla for fun but it takes over 1 hour. use the metro. - Room is VERY small. no joke. bathroom is not as impressive as people make it sound. Shower was going from hot to cold all the time. - No mini-fridge in the room. Good luck keeping your free water cold. or anything else really. - Breakfast was nice but costs 14 euro per person. no way senor! go to cafe firenze around the corner. All in all, you can stay there only for the beach but dont expect much. For anything else, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: hollybluebutterfly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and clean. The reception staff were pleasant but ineffective. We were a little disappointed to find the hotel was further out of the centre than we'd expected but this wasn't a great problem as we used the tourist bus which stopped just round the corner from the hotel. The rooms were good and the beds really comfortable. Unfortunately the floors were not carpeted and noise due to foot fall levels was high late at night and early in the morning. We did appreciate the bottled water which was available as you came out of the lift. We stayed at the hotel for 4 days and on two occasions our room hadn't been serviced by 16.30... when I rang reception they told me they'd been busy and did I want the matter reporting to the manager. I said I would and I'm still waiting for his response.... We were told that the bar and catering had been franchised out - perhaps this explains the fact that although the bar is advertised as being open until 1pm it was near impossible to get a nightcap after 11.30... There was also a problem with breakfasts - they didn't always replace items that had run out ie butter, orange juice, coffee etc. I wouldn't recommend this hotel, but can't wait to go back to Barcolona.

Reviews.Title: “more minuses than pluses”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Mrs-Scout
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very out of the way in a residential area, 10-15 mins from the metro and about 8 stops into the city. with little else than the beach, no bars/resturants really. But on the last night we found a shopping complex near the Hilton with lots of food places to eat so look out for it and far cheaper than in the city. (you cant see it from the road and there are no signs) The front of house staff at hotel quite surley and rude. We could not check in when we arrived so left our bag and went to have a drink on the beach, which is across the road, well two major motorway type roads across a bridge, the beaches are lovely and clean with toilets, showers and nice cafe/bars on each. Be aware tho a sunbed costs 5 euros! We went back 2 hrs later still unable to check in so waited in the bar, this had been 4 hours since we arrived, we are not ones to complain but the staff were down right rude and only after we complained they reluctently let us use the spa to shower and change, and were told they had no idea when the room would be ready, and shrugged their shoulders! so we went off into Barcelona. The food at the hotel was expensive and very dissapointing, the rooms very small, great bathroom and king size bed tho. for a four star hotel it lacks the added extas like a mini bar, good air-con, spacious rooms. No extractor fan in bathroom so impossible to do your hair and makeup if one of you in shower and no mirrors in the room, we ended up using the reflection in the telly if one of us were showering. No drawers only shelves in wardrobe and the suitcase only just fitted in the bottom. Two of you couldnt get around the bottom of the bed at once the room was so small. Our room was at the back so was quiet. It seemed mainly full of buisness people and the spa facilities wernt up to much, the sauna was the size of a cupboard and in my opnion very dangerous, i tried to use it only to burn myself on the coals and bang my head on the light, and the bench is far too high. It was clean tho with a nice changing room and shower. The tour bus stops around the corner which is a must, its a huge city, and quite expensive, think we'll go somewhere the euro isnt next time!

Reviews.Title: “21st Present”
Reviews.Author: princessdippy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a week in hotrel maritim for my 21st. It was a very basic hotel, the bathroom was beautiful but the rooms themselves were relatively small and the bed was really really uncomfortable. Also the walls were very thin so it was hard to sleep at night with two noisy neighbours. On the plus side the hotel was very clean and the blacked out curtain was great considering i love a lie in!!!! Food wise we loved staying by the port, check out a place called "Mangos" on the beach beautiful tapas and paella. Regarding the night life at the port it wasnt like crazy, alot of dancers for the guys and some for the girls too. Kennedys Irish pub made thee best sex on the beach cocktails ever, although they were almost ten euro a drink which was a bit expensive. I definatly recommend the bus tour takes you everywhere and is a great day out. The beach is beautiful aswell and is very wheelchair accessible which is something very hard to find. Regarding las ramblas it was good, we only went a few times and it depends really what you like but in all barcelona and the hotel was a very good break for people of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard”
Reviews.Author: jim2608
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in March 2008. The room was clean and modern, with very comfortable beds. The bathroom was fine too, with a powerful modern shower. As stated by previous guests, the free mineral water is a real plus, and there are also two computers with free internet beside reception, with usage capped at 20 mins per person. All the staff we encountered were friendly and efficient. Our rate did not include breakfast (this is 14 Euros per person) but there is a cafe/bakery around the corner which sells a mixture of breads/croissants for very reasonable rates. Clearly this hotel is not in the very centre of Barcelona, however Selva de Mar metro is less than 10 mins walk, and from here it is only 6 stops from Jaume I station which is right in the centre of the city. Also, the official "Bus Turistic" stop is less than 100 metres from the hotel. The area around the Maritim is quite modern, with the large Diagonal Mar shopping centre only 5 mins walk away if this is your thing (there is a huge supermarket here, along with a Zara, Springfield, and a Hello Kitty shop!) We didn't feel at all unsafe walking back to the hotel late at night. Barcelona itself was excellent, you could easily spend a week here if you are a museum/culture buff. We took the train ourselves to Montserrat (line R5 from Espanya) - this costs around 20 Euros per person including the rack railway ticket to the top of the hill. The journey takes just over an hour. I would highly recommend this trip - the views were stunning. We also took an organised excursion with Rabbies tours to the Pyrenees, this involved a stop in the old town of Vic, and then taking the rack railway from Queralbs to the top at Vall de Nuria. I would give the tour 7/10 - I enjoyed the trip to the top, and our guide Rodrigo was excellent, however I didn't feel the itinerary posted on Rabbies website was entirely accurate - it mentions a multitude of activities you can do at Nuria - however none of these were possible because of snow and don't seem to open for a few weeks yet. Other points - even if Barca aren't at home you can go and see Espanyol play at home as we did (tickets from 25 euros). We also did the Barca tour which was good - just buy your tickets on the day at the stadium (17 Euros). Best restaurant we visited - Bella Napoli on Carrer de Margarit (just off the Parallel).

Reviews.Title: “I really didn't like this hotel.........”
Reviews.Author: AntonFrance
Reviews.Content: There were one or two positives, but generally I didn't like this hotel. There were no bathtubs, only showers in the bathroom. The shower temperature kept going scalding hot whilst I used it - not pleasant. Beds were rock hard and seriously uncomfortable. The a/c did not work and the rooms were boiling hot. Not possible to open the window due to the noise of the traffic. The reception staff were very frosty and unwelcoming. The room doors slammed closed and were so noisy that I'd wake up with a start every time someone came in or out of their room on my floor. TV remote control did not work and no BBC World channel as promised. Plus points - free mineral water, beach location and blackout curtain in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: berbarito
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Front Maritim for one night only but what I remember about this hotel is an excellent experience. It is located on just opposite the beach. I loved the sidewalks and roadside trees round there, they were absolutely neat and clean. Later I found out that there is a bus stop nearer then metro station, and tourist bus stop a bit further. So it was convenient to get to city centre. But there is nothing to do around the hotel. The rooms are apart from the building that the reception is, I had to walk through basement to reach my room. Which means, with luggage, you have to use the elevators twice. But I really enjoyed drinking free bottles of water provided in the passageway. Room was perfectly clean, even if it seemed a little bit small. Bathroom was decorated well with a absolutely lovely shower. You have to be really careful, there were lamps stuck to the wall beside each bed for reading i think. After turing it on some time, when I touched it, I burnt my fingers. They are EXTREMELY HOT so do not try to move them at all. I could nearly see the wonderful beach from the window, the sun rising. Breakfast was literally great. The staff were not friendly but I didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality/price ratio”
Reviews.Author: DSwissK
Reviews.Content: We had an offer on a website so maybe you won't find this price anymore. (360 CHF for 3 nights for both of us). Everything is clean. You can have free FRESH water in bottles. Great idea. There is a hammam also. Staff is not friendly but it's not important for me. If it is for you, don't go there. Location is not great but with the metro/coaches you're quickly in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Poor location”
Reviews.Author: mickandjos
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel with good breakfast but as we booked this as a last minute break we did not realise that this hotel is a long way from the city centre. You can get a bus from the back of the hotel which takes around 15 mins. The olympic port was around 30 minute walk away from the hotel or a 10 minute bus ride away, here there is a wide choice of resturants and a lovely beach. You can get on the tour bus too which will take you all round Barcelonas hot spots. We also visited the zoo which was brilliant and very cheap. Overall holiday was ok, just make sure you pack your walking shoes. We stayed for 4 days and had done most by the 3rd day so that on our last day we had to check out the hotel by noon and we had a night flight, we walked around a bit again but did get quite bored as we had seen everything that interested us, we did end up going to the airport 8 hours early for our flight.

Reviews.Title: “TOURIST TRAP - can't get a good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: Jazna4
Reviews.Content: I love Barcelona but we were VERY dissapointed with the hotel accomodation. You can hardly call it a 4 star hotel. The rooms are small and dated but most importantly the beds are very uncomfortable, the shower was broken. The road noise is unbearable. The hotel serves a very poor buffet breakfast (near the reception area!) ,that is not included in the price. The staff is arrogant and unhelpful. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireHatters
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good 3* overlooking the beach and close to the Marina, had its own parking and was a 2 minute walk to the tourist bus stop that travels around Barcelona.The rooms were spacious and gave you 4 pillows!!!. They were decorated well and had alovely shower. At Breakfast there was a good choice to suit everyone. A reasonable priced good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shaan18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the final 2 nights of our honeymoon. The so callled 4 star hotel had dirty sheets, stained blankets, and a bug in the shower. They don't even offer a comforter. On top of that that the staff is very rude when you ask for something. I looked at another room, only to find the same problems (stained sheets). We we were so disgusted we just stayed out all night on our 2nd night to avoid sleeping in those beds. Also note that the metro line at this hotel is down for the summer, there is a free shuttle bus (15 min walk) that takes you to the BarcaloNETA station (NOT CENTRAL BARCELONA). The bus takes a while though. Also service not available after 12 or 2am. Taxi is $$$. Only good thing was, it's right across the beach. PAY A BIT MORE AND stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: markbbk
Reviews.Content: Family of four, stayed five nights in Barcelona. Clean functional hotel close to the beach. Close to a hugh shopping centre which has plenty of restauants. Ten minute walk to metro and then 15min to center of barca, hotel did not have much of an atmosphere, Small bar which closed at 12mn and bar staff spent most of the time serving in the restaurant, ie had to wait about 10min to get served. Good hotel to stay if you don't expect more from your hotel than a place to sleep. Also free bottled water to guests and two free computers for intrnet.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!Good location!”
Reviews.Author: ShonaArnside
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in June 2007 and had a great time! Hotel is very clean, friendly and modern. It is right opposite the beach which was nice for a rest from the city centre. You can get the red tour buses just round the corner from the hotel which is really handy, and theres also a bus which goes right into town from just behind the hotel (only about £1.20 per person). Breakfast was good and varied, and bedrooms were great! Yes maybe a little small but we just had a 'standard' room with a side seaview and it was faultless really.. Oh except no tea/coffe making facilities but this didn't bother us. Best thing was the walk in shower! GREAT!! The bathroom was very modern and the beds very comfy! All in all a great hotel, in a good location away from the noise you might experience in a city centre hotel but near enough to get into the centre by metro/bus etc. Only cost us £150 for the two of us for three nights through otel.com! Bargain!!

Reviews.Title: “100% Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: JellyBellyDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Front Maritim for only one night, but it was an exceptional experience. Very clean, very modern, and incredible value for your money. What makes this hotel even more so outstanding, is that they posted back my mobile, charger and adapter, once I realised I had left them behind! I had the phone in my hands within 4 days of leaving the hotel. Now that was above and beyond the call of duty in today's selfish era! T he hotel staff are very accomodating and the rooms are quite trendy. I especially liked how they offered a free minibar of water (still and sparkling) to their guests at any time of the day/night. Their one and only downfall is the location. It is quite far from the city, but the bus transportation in Barcelona is superb and you're back in the citycentre in 20minutes! Or you could do what we did and take the tourist bus (5 min walk from hotel) back into town! Also its VERY close to the beaches, so that's a benefit too if you want to steer clear of the madness of Barcelona and mosey about with "the locals"

Reviews.Title: “Quite fine”
Reviews.Author: mediageezer
Reviews.Content: Excellent value hotel with good rooms, good service and great location for Mar Bella beach. It's a little way out of the Barcelona buzz and thus cab fares do mount up. Staff were helpful and friendly. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Front Maritim Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: nikolaas7
Reviews.Content: After a terrible night near the Ramblas we decided to trade the citycentre for a hotel near the beach. We rented bikes and head for Front Maritim. The rooms had everything we needed, it's simple but clean, silent and comfortbale. The rooms aren't big but fine for resting and sleeping. Friendly staff, no problem parking bikes in the Car parking.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny tiny tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tagesthemen
Reviews.Content: I was here on business, but I still could appreciate that for somebody here on holiday, it is perfectly located for the beach. Rooms at the front have a sea view. Very beautiful. Perfect location for the CCIB convention centre. If you intend to stay any time in your room (I did some work), this hotel is not for you. The rooms are really tiny. A little bit like a hostel. No alarm clock and a television that doesn't really work. The bathroom is nice however. No minibar but free water in the corridor. Not helpful if you want a coke or something like that. Only 6 "business" rooms, so difficult to get an upgrade. Restuarant staff were very friendly. Front desk staff mixed. We had the most unbelievably rude guy but others were helpful. Generally it seemed a bit chaotic. If you buy a cable, you can get free internet access (5 euros). This is good value. Do not ask reception for a taxi. It takes forever. Hail one on the street. Generally the hotel rooms are nice but the size and comfort of the rooms do not make this a luxury hotel. In addition we had a bad experience with this guy on the front desk as we were leaving (he even swore at us in Spanish thinking we could not understand any Spanish), which ruined this hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ksmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Front Maritim for 2 nights and had a great time. This hotel is across the road from the beach and within walking distance of the Port Olympic, which has great restaurants and night life. It is a bit further from Las Ramblas but not too bad if you like walking. The hotel has good size rooms, gym facilities and a great breakfast buffet. We could not fault this hotel and thought it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Maedog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Front Maritim on June 3rd & 4th. We were pleasantly surprised by the helpful front desk staff. We arrived early for our room, but the staff stored our luggage and informed us our room would be ready in just a few hours. The room was small (this place definitely caters for business travelers) but immaculate. The bed was quite comfortable, no problems with the shower water pressure, and the room had minimalist Ikea decor. Our floor had about three small refrigerators that contained bottled water, free to the guests. The breakfast buffet had generous amounts of food: ham, manchego cheese, coffee, bread, danish, spanish omelet, bacon, yogurt, fruit, and a variety of fresh juices. The lobby also has two computers with free internet access, though printing is not an option. While this Hotel is a bit off the beaten path, it is located only 3 blocks from a metro stop, which was quite easy to navigate. Located right in front of the hotel is a wide footpath with a lovely view of the Med. Great for exercise or just taking in the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TSL7805
Reviews.Content: Easy to reach Metro station (10 mins walk). Near the beautiful beach, Fair breakfast, Nice staff. Free Internet access in lobby , but no wifi. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for the football”
Reviews.Author: Jamie73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 27th-29th March with my 4 year old son. We were in Barcelona to watch Andorra v England which was unfortunate. Just glad I booked this back in July and didn't pay England football prices. Hotel was fantastic, staff were very friendly and accomodating with my son. Only problem was room size, but I was aware they were small having read reviews on here. Also distance from centre, as we were only there a couple of days I used taxis and on average paid about 8 euros to Las Ramblas, again I was aware of this before we went. Good news is proximity to the Diagonal Mar shopping centre which offered a couple of play parks for him on the way and also a relatively good choice of restaurants. Would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to explore amazing city”
Reviews.Author: CWALM
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent trip advisor user, I thought I should contribute back. My boyfreind and I stayed in this hotel last year and it was excellent, located in easy walking distance to a metro which quickly gets you to main centre. The hotel was brilliant, excellent service, the staff were very helpful and friendly.....We had a late departure and the hotel looked after our luggage and let us use the gym facilities to change and have a shower before our flight home in the evening!! The bathrooms were amazing, especially the shower, large enough for a number of people!! It sounds strange but I still remember to this day how the pillows were the best I had ever slept on !! We walked into the city on one occasion along the beach.It took a while but was an enjoyable walk. The breakfast at the hotel was also very good, well worth checking when you book that the price includes this as many websites did not. (we booked through GTA Hotels) Many people get pick pocketed along las ramblas, however if you are aware and sensible this should not happen to you as there will be many easier targets - let that not be you! We had our charactures drawn down this street and were well worth the money. The artist was very friendly and did a good job, providing entertainment for passers by - lets say the portraits are not flattering! :0) I would defintely return to Barcelona without a 2nd thought, and I would stay in this hotel again. It is nice to be out of the main city area sometimes, and it is very easy to get around the city. Also there is a HUGE shopping centre right next door, we had great fun, bowling and shopping one night!

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend in Barca!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha025
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend decided to have a girlie weekend and thought where else but Barca!! The hotel was gorgeous, really modern! The actual bedroom however was right let down, extremly basic! For a 4* hotel it should have been better, but afterall we only needed a bed to sleep at night. The bathroom was stunning. The free water in the fridge at the end of the corridor, great idea (considering there was no fridge in the rooms), but really needs to to stocked up more often. The staff were fantastic! So friendly and made you feel so welcome. All in all we had a great time and would go back for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on the sea front”
Reviews.Author: ryb1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed just the one night whilst on a business trip on my own in Barcelona. The property is located on the sea front, which wasn't particularly handy in January, but I can say that at this time of year, this location is especially quiet. If you are worried that it's going to be difficult to get to the main attractions, please don't be. It's an easy 10-minute walk to the nearest metro, then 6 or 7 stops to the centre, perhaps a single change and another couple of stops depending on where you're headed. Onto the hotel itself: it has a clean, modern feel to it. The reception staff were friendly enough. The ground floor is all open-plan, the bar round the back of the reception area, and the dining area separated from the lobby and bar by a large arty screen. There's a computer area and national and international newspapers between the entrance and the dining area. I like booking hotels with gyms, and although the gym here was not state-of-the-art, it was passable, with a decent treadmill, multigym and loose weights. I thought the stereo in there was a nice touch, but unfortunately it was broken. I was a little distressed at the lack of minibar in the room, although a positive quirk of the Front Maritim is the presence of fridges packed full of bottles of free still and sparkling mineral water positioned at the end of each corridor! This was a lovely touch. It's a bit weird these days for business-oriented hotels in major cities not to have wireless internet availability.
