They must have invested in cable internet socket installations just before Wifi took off, and they are stubbonly insistent on getting their money's worth. If you don't have a cable with you, you can buy them from reception for €5. Breakfast was OK, but there was no hot option. I was grateful that they had a flexible attitude to my leaving the car in their garage for no extra charge for a few hours after I had checked out. Good on them. I'd definitely stay here again, and would recommend it for like-minded business travellers. If you need to be in the hub of the action, or if you don't like taking the metro, then it might be less appealing to you, but it could be worth a look just for the comfort level that you get for the price they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location a bit distant”
Reviews.Author: Mymmeli
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner on May 2006. The location is a bit distant, about 10 minutes walk to the metro station from where it takes about 15 minutes to reach the center of Barcelona. However, we got a very cheap price for this hotel so we decided to book. There is a beach nearby (5 minutes walk) with all services: toilets, shower, kiosks selling food and beverages. Also there is a big shopping center about 10 minutes walk away. There are not much restaurants in this area and especially not good ones - they are selling some cheap, frozen food made in the microwave so you have to go somewhere else for a dinner. The hotel is new, very clean with nice interior design and the rooms are comfortable. The room was a perfect size for us but there should have been more space to clothes for example - we don't want to keep our staff in the bags if we stay in a hotel for a week or more. The bathroom was very nice and there were shampoo, soap, shower caps and so on. There is no lock in the bathroom door which might bother someone. We stayed in a non-smoking floor but our neighbours seemed to be having some kind of a noisy party and they started smoking in their room. All the smoke came to our room as the air conditioning is probably desingned for non-smoking purposes. I complained about this to the staff and they promised to take care of it. We didn't notice any smoke after that night so I guess the staff took care of it. The breakfast was great: toasts, pastries, cheese, ham, vegetables, eggs, bagon, coffee/tea/hot chocolate, juice, fruits and so on. Some mornings there were too much people at the same time so we had to wait about 15 minutes to get a table. Also some mornings the staff had difficulties in responding the amount of people - coffee, tea and milk run out as well as coffee cups and plates. So people had to wait over 15 minutes to get cups and coffee... We also had a lunch at the hotel one day which was a mistake. I had some fish which was accidentally left raw and was awful, like a chewing gum. I only ate the side dish and complained about this to the waiter. He said that he would speak with the chef and then came back with our bill - with no discount of the fish which I wasn't able to eat as it wasn't properly cooked! I told him that I expect a compensation and he replied that the chef had tasted the fish and found it perfect. After arguing with me for a while he asked his superior from the reception to join the conversation and we continued this argumentation as I wasn't willing to pay for the food. Finally the boss promised that I would get the meal for free - after I had told him that I didn't want to continue arguing anymore and promised to pay for the food. However, this kind of incident shouldn't happen in 4 star hotel. If a customer says that food is not ok, it's not ok and that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Bit far from the center, tho.”
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Front Maritim for four days. It was a very good experience - the hotel, although far from the tourist attractions, is really good, with a very nice breakfast and well served by bus, tram and subway. Plus, it is close to a shopping mall with loads of restaurants and a supermarket. As for being far from tourist attractions, bear in mind that Barcelona is a modern city and, as such, the attractions are very spread (different from an old town with everything concentrated in the center), so you'll need to get public transportation anyway! In that sense, the hotel location cannot be considered a "con". Especially because it is across the street from the beach, and the view is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to do!”
Reviews.Author: richie13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights on our honeymoon before going on a cruise. Its a modern hotel but there doesnt appear to be any leisure facilities available. Apparently there was a sauna but we couldnt find it!! The bar was tiny and there was a permanently empty restaurant/dining room! We actually cancelled our 5 day post cruise stay and flew home instead!

Reviews.Title: “ok, and nice, but boring”
Reviews.Author: heavans
Reviews.Content: So there isn't anything wrong with this hotel, but if the weather isn't great (as it was on our trip) then being across the street from the beach doesn't really make a big difference. There were a lot of retiree tour groups going through when we were there, and the trip from city center to hotel was a little annoying after the first 2 nights, the walk from the metro isn't long but it also is more than 5 minutes. Inside the hotel, everything is very high class, very nice, and clean, no complaints. but if you want to go out in the city and possibly experience more of a barcelona feel, then I wouldn't recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Dreamer7
Reviews.Content: Loved it loved it loved it!!! We stayed for 5 nights in July and have to say never wandered very far from the beach!! Breakfast was outstanding, egyptian cotton sheets fab pillows and air con in a spotless room, what more can you want! The beach is right across the road where the bars sell pizza and salads along with a full bar menu. Beware of the vodka here though, its free poured and you can get carried away easily. We were at a bar on the beach one night and while he ordered another beer I had enough coke left so ordered just a vodka. The girl said "vodka solo" i said yes and she returns with a half pint of vodka!!!!! I loved the shopping centre around the corner Diagonal Mar and great restaurants open here at night also. The market stalls along La Rambla cant be missed either for their hand made jewelery. I found it extremly hot in the city however and loved to go back to the sea to cool off. On leaving my partner managed to leave his wallet behind and after one email to them the wallet arrived in the post within 3 days with no charge to us! Excellant! Will recommend it until I'm hoarse and will return next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: toonsteve
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for a week and found the Tripadvisor reviews very useful! The hotel is excellent! The rooms are spotless and of great quality and the air conditioning is awesome! The free water is a great perk too. The staff were helpful and polite - though we didn't eat there at all. Location-wise, it's great for the beaches which are all walkable from the hotel - the ones closer to the town (Port Olimpic, Barcelonetta) have better facilities than the one opposite the Hotel. The metro is the best way to get around in my opinion. It was a 5-10 min walk from the hotel and it takes you along the coast to any of the resorts and then into the city. We found Barcelona expensive, especially on the beach resorts though it seems to be much cheaper in the city, even on the Ramblas. Eat at the Barri Gotic, it's atmospheric and authentic. Food on the beaches is nice but pricey and you feel a bit like you're in Tenerife or somewhere with people trying to get you into every restaurant. Tapas is excellent everywhere. We used the Diagonal Shopping Centre near the hotel on arrival but weren't impressed. Front Maritim is a great place to go back to after a night in the city and I would recommend it to anyone. If it was in the city itself, it would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rojinegro
Reviews.Content: Next time in Barcelona, look no further, across the street from the Beach and "close" to downtown and a few blocks from a Metro station. Excellent service, friendly staff, just great, I had a great time in Barcelona and the hotel and the location of it, had a lot to do with it. Have a question ask Laura at the reception, she will find you the answer. A four stars hotel with a five stars service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! minutes to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Lindazz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in total as we ventured around Barcelona. I read these pages relentlessly beforehand too. The hotel is in great condition and the rooms are impressive. The staff were friendly and the beach is a 3-5 minute walk away, not only that but there are bars set up on the beach great for afternoon drinking and tapas! I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to go to Barcelona, its a 15EURO cab fare in to La Ramblas or the buses stop right outside the hotel (the tourist sightseeing bus too) the train station is only a 5-10 minute walk also.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: JMC1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights. The rooms were clean and simple. The free bottled water near the elevator is such a great idea! I was attending a convention at the Hotel Arts - which was sold out (not to mention ridiculously expnsive). I booked this hotel because it was close to the Arts, super cheap (Expedia) and free internet access. The beach front is also a plus. Not to worry about noise from the road - the window is sound proof. Ask for a room facing the beach. There is a gym - but, you are better off running along the beach since it is in the basement of the hotel and it is very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: Sinead0577
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel for 4 nights for my sister's 21st birthday present. Found prospect of finding a hotel in Barcelona quite daunting, but ended up going with this one having read many reviews, and I have to say we were not disappointed. Can't understand anyone having a problem here, but I suppose you can't please everyone!! Location was excellent for us as we were looking forward to a relaxing break. 5 minutes stroll from beach, which was great. Another 5 minutes or so to Diagonal Mar Shopping Centre, which we spent a day in. Food in hotel restaurant was really nice, but we were left waiting about 1hr 25min the first time we ate there - our order was delivered to another table. A bit annoyed but got over it. Staff very friendly, and as in other reviews bottled water was great. Didn't bother with internet as the couple of times we went down they were occupied. Rooms small but more than adequate. Bathroom very modern - a lock on the door would have been nice though...and don't get a shock when you see the frosted glass door!! All in all very pleased and would definitely recommend. Paid €560 for flights and 4 nights accomodation for the 2 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Not for long stays”
Reviews.Author: Tiler John
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends for a long weekend in May this year and that's about as long as you could because the bedrooms although very modern and trendy have tiny built in wardrobes where you have to hang your clothes diagonally to get them in. My wife likes to take a change of clothes for every day and we had to cram them in the the wardrobe. The room was quite small but ample for our trip, as other travellers have commented the bathroom is very smart but a little gloomy for wet shavers! We ate in the hotel restaurant on the first night and it was virtually empty. The staff were attentive without being overbearing and the food was very good. If you go out to eat turn left out of the hotel and five minutes walk away you will find the Diagonal shopping centre with a large selection of restaurants and bars. Turn right and you'll walk for miles before you find anything. if you go th the Diagonal then avoid the Tapas Bar. It is one of a chain and the food and service were dire. The food arrived in dribs and drabs and was not worth eating. We ate some great tapas in Barcelona and this was the only bad stuff. The tourist buses stop just around the corner from the hotel and they are great value. One word of warning, the weekend we chose coincided with the arrival of the air racing circuit and they had concreted over the beach opposite the hotel to make a runway. Whether or not they'll dig it all up again remains to be seen. We had chosen this hotel because it was opposite the beach and were a little disappointed but it didn't spoil our impressions of Barcelona or the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the hotel in Barcelona on April 30 and stayed there till May 6/06. The hotel looks GREAT. Exactly like the photos provided by Expedia. The hotel's look is very modern & simple. The elevators are really small though, it can hold only 2 adults with luggage! haha. The hotel rooms are nice, clean, but kind of small. We had no problem with the room size ourselves but I know that many people would have a problem with it. Especially if you are travelling with lots of large luggage. We both each had one large luggage suitcase and they fit fine. There is a small closet, which hangs a few items such as a suit, dress and shelves to put your shoes in there. The bathroom is AMAZING. A huge shower with frosted glass divider. A very modern in set glass bowl & counter. Very clean!!! There is also a tv, but I must warn you - it does not have very many english channels on it. The wake up phone services were great. Maid services were great. Front desk very helpful and kind- all english speaking. There is no safe in the room but there is a room behind the front desk where you can get your own personal safe with key. The deposit for the safe is $30 Euros. You can go in and out of the safe as you please. The hotel restaurant is good. Food was excellent. Service good- but remember the lifestyle in Spain is very laid back so don't expect to go into any restaurant and expect to be served and done eating in 30 mins. There are restaurants all over the area, most of them have english translations with is helpful if you do not know spanish. Over all, we both loved this place and do recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hynesy23
Reviews.Content: Hotel was Clean and in a good location. The Breakfast was only OK with the hot food being the same every Morning and sometimes Cold. Also it got very crowded at times. The bar lacked atmosphere at nigh time. The Free Water and internet was great although another couple of internet stations would be good. Shower was out of this world. Power + , you could stay in it all day. Could have done with more English TV channels also. Would recommend though . Just being very critical.

Reviews.Title: “2 Great Weeks!”
Reviews.Author: 1TheAlbion
Reviews.Content: We had 2 great weeks in Barelona in August 2005 and found the Hotel Front Maritim the perfect base to explore this wonderful City! Ok the rooms are quite small, but who goes to Barcelona to spend time in their bedroom?!? The fantastic shower, regular maid service and free water were all enough to counter this very slight negative. Also found that free Internet usage in the Hotel's lobby was a great way to plan the holiday - where to eat, drink and dance! We found the location to be very relaxing; once you find the local Metro stop - a 10 minute walk to "Selva de Mar", the City is your Oyster! A mere 10-15 minute journey and you are in the heart of Barcelona, but it's nice to leave that all behind at the end of an evening and return to the safe and quiet area of the Front Maritim. Literally a 5 minute taxi journey or even a 20 minute stroll from the very cool "Ciutadella Villa Olimpica" where the fantastic "Hotel Arts" is situated - cannot recommend highly enough the stunning Arola restaurant, where the finest Tapas are served! The beaches of Nova Mar Bella and Barceloneta are a short stroll from the Hotel (5 mins) and are very clean; the Service in the beach cafes does leave a little bit to be desired though, it has to be said - just make sure you aren't ever in a rush! We booked through Expedia (£500/€729 for 2 weeks) and have since recommended the Front Maritim to other family members.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel from 9 March through 14 March. When you arrive for breakfast, the assistant should tell you that you have to pay for breakfast – we did not know this. Breakfast is an astounding 25 Euros! The room service is, to be blunt, terrible. Every morning I ordered a very simple item, tea with milk. The tea would be cold and there would be no milk. One morning I got coffee. The delay between calling and receiving the tea could be anything up to 20 minutes. The room service staff were unfriendly and rude when delivering the tea. I believe the room service staff are the same as those serving at the bar and in the restaurant. They are rude, slamming items down on tables. Requesting toasted bread seemed to be a major issue during breakfast, as though you had asked them for a 3 course meal. They do not smile. They act as though they are the client and you are the staff. In the evening there is one bar man. He is never there when you want him. You have to wait ages as he is doing other jobs/roles. They all need customer service education. What is the point of these staff dealing with clients when they do not like them, or even pretend to do so? I also think the hotel needs more staff. My main area of complaint is room service and the service in the bar/restaurant. Service badly needs attention. Other than that the hotel is well maintained, especially the room cleaning and housekeeping. The hotel is ideally located.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, too far out”
Reviews.Author: shaz_doogan
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel from 28th Feb 2006 for 4nights,i took my boyfriend for his birthday! i choose this hotel from readin reviews on this site. the hotel looked like it does in the photos,the lobby is hugh n the staff are nice n polite but as soon as we got to the room disaster struck - it was tiny! i read in the reviews that the rooms are small but i didnt think they were going to be as small as they actually were - tiny! but the bathroom was lovely & the shower was heaven, the bed was also very comfy! but the walls are thin as we could hear the people in the room next door enjoyin themselves in bed!! there is free bottled water at the end of every corridor which is nice. we went to go sight seeing but the buses were a disaster,the drivers couldnt speak much english n the hotel is SO far away from the main shopping street-Las Rambles so i would not recommend this hotel if you wanted to be in the centre of things. the hotel is nice because its beside the beach n there is a lovely big shoppin centre 5mins walk away! but still its just too far away from everythin! we spent a forture on buses n taxis! the hotel is lovely (but expensive to eat in) the only faults i could find was that the rooms were too small & the location wasnt great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pam_Pat
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Hotel Front Maritim. Great hotel, very clean & comfortable, staff very helpful with good english. The rooms are great, small but perfect for a 3 day stay, very modern with a great shower! Cable tv in the rooms with BBC world CNN etc. Our room looked over the beach which was beautiful to wake up to every morning!! Free bottle water in a cooler on each floor which was great. Buffet breakfast was lovely, a very good selection of hot & cold. Free internet use in the library just off the reception, great for checking emails!! The hotel is about 20 mins. walk from the Olympic Port, lovely stroll down the seafront with great restaurants and bars. We found it much better staying just a little outside the city, very relaxing and refreshing! It only costs around 6 eur for a taxi right into the middle of anywhere in the city or the metro is just around the corner. Very safe area with a fantastic shopping mall 5 mins walk away. Great place to stay would definitely go back again. We had a ball looking forward to going back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “the place to stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few days and it was great.It was spotless. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English. The food was nice (the free sweets at the reception desk were great).It was near the mettro stations and the nou camp the beach was also just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Breakfast..nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for four nights recently and had a great time! We thought the breakfast was excellent well well above average!!! the rooms on the smallish side no balcony's,but hey how long are you in them! Great walk in shower plenty of room for two.! Rooms could do with some soundproofing though as we could hear when next door came back just putting there key in the door!! so I'm pretty damn sure they could hear us...!! Barcelona just a great place loads going on I found the locals very helpful most times but did get the impression they not too keen on the british! (even less to the very loud brash americans!) They would be horrified of the behaviour you find in other spanish resorts! This is'nt that type of place it is very cosmopolitan and coupley, soooo many places to eat and drink a bit pricey though.. I hired a car from the airport which I am glad of cost wise if you are doing your own transfers we met another couple who paid 48 euros from the licenced yellow and black cabs from outside the airport. You do see a hell of a lot more with your own transport if you want to sightsee in the day, but it is a bit stressful driving around there as everything is on a one way system and everywhere starts to look the same after a bit but is fine once you get your bearings..At nightime we walked upto the port olympic 30min walkalong the promenade where you will see some dodgy nakedness along the way(by dodgy I only mean all shapes and sizes!) The port is just a fantastic place really nice clean harbour loads of bars/restaurants and a very safe feeling place which I really liked, to get a cab back to the hotel from the port only 6 euros and there are thousands of taxi's do make sure you have the address of the hotel they dont have a clue if you just use the name, and from the fabulous las ramblas 10 euros each way. The absolutely beautiful font magica where freddie mercury sang barcelona when they had the olympics is an absolute must we went at 10 o'clock and we both felt the wow facter it was our best night,(Dont bother in the day the water is switched off the show is 8till midnight) All in all I cant wait to go back to barcelona in the future,would stay at this hotel again it was a goodbase with a fab breakfast,but would want to hire the car again as it is a bit of treck to places or a lot of taxi fares to get about or a hike to the metro, I saw the place much more of a couples holiday and would'nt of liked to have gone with two small children although there are things there, but if you are looking for a family holiday stick to tenerife,majorca etc there is so much more available to familys there.. Have a great holiday wherever you go..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Summerl”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back after a 4 night stay in this hotel. During the hot summertime, when your too hot to keep walking and sightseeing ,THIS is the best location to stay: right at the beach. Nova Mar Bella is the most attractive beach in Barcelona, though it can be quit crowded..it is not as crowded as the Bogatell and Barceloneta area. The beach is suprisingly clean and in the night it is nice and romantic to have a picnic at the beach..just as the locals do. Jus get some nice calamares, wine and bread in the around the corner supermercado and enjoy eating, drinking and staring at the stares at night, maybe even take a swim. And after the picnic you just have a seat in the nearest beachbar...too hot in the inner city anyway. The brakfast is excellent, the staf friendly...the cleaning of the rooms just perfect..the mini bar with free bottled waters and apples are just a nice service. During SUMMER I would definitely take this hotel again.But during winter/spring tome I probably take a hotel in the city centre since it IS kind of a drag with the metro. However..the subway is only 10 minutes walking from the hotel... Next to the hotel is an asian restaurant but the service there completely ---- . Don't advice that unless you really have to (which is probably often the case). And around the hotel there's not much to go to, so like i said...a good hotel for summertime where you at least have a sit at the many beachclubs that are quit active. However..this is probably an area in the making...a lot of projects so in 3 years or so things probably be changed I miss the hotel and the wonderful beach allready...also the excellent breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Opinion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend recently came back from a four night stay at the Hotel Front Maratim (18/05 - 22/05). The hotel was not my first choice (or even in my top 10) as we were there purely for sightseeing but because of the availablity in the city we ended up here. Whilst this hotel is within touching distance of what is a better than average "city beach" this hotel is in the business quarter and subsequently has a lot of conference related guests and if I am totally honest it is too far out from the Gothic/Diagonal/Marina area of the city and after a hard days sight seeing it is a real hassle to get back to the hotel for a laydown. The nearest Metro stop is "Selva del Mar" about 8 minutes walk from the hotel, then its about another 10 minutes direct on the tube into the Gothic quarter (Jaume I Metro). A taxi from the marina at about midnight was never more than 8 eruros. The hotel itself is very clean and the rooms are average sized, we had a queen sized bed which was massive and took up half of the room. The bathroom/shower room was nicely finished. One important thing I would say is make sure you check that breakfast is included with your room rate, we booked a typical double via Expedia and breakfast wasnt included and we ende up paying 11 euros each for what was a very poor breakfast. ********* Whilst this has nothing to do with the hotel I feel I should say that we were mugged leaving Selva del Mar metro and had a bag containg money and a passport stollen by locals. Yes we were using the metro after midnight but still, be careful, when we went to the embassy to get a new passport there were 5 other people in there at the same time all of whome had been robbed. My recommendation would be not to use the Metro after about 11, taxi's are pretty cheap and there's loads of them about.

HotelInfo.Name: GBB Hotel Front Maritim
HotelInfo.Address: Paseo Garcia Faria 69, 08019 Barcelona, Spain
